content:
Hedy Lamarr was an actress and inventor who made significant contributions to the development of modern wireless technology. In the 1940s, Lamarr and composer George Antheil developed a frequency-hopping system for torpedo guidance that used a piano roll to randomly change radio frequencies. This technology was never adopted for military use, but it laid the groundwork for modern spread-spectrum communication technologies like Wi-Fi and Bluetooth.

Lamarr's contributions to wireless technology serve as an important reminder
